oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Voltage and current stress induced variations in TiN/HfSixOy/TiN MIM capacitors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MISRA, D
KASINATH, J
CHANDORKAR, AN
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: INSULATOR-METAL CAPACITORS
SILICON
HFO2
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper we have investigated the long-term reliability of TiN/HfSixOy/TiN Metal-Insulator-Metal (MIM) capacitors by using constant voltage stress (CVS) and constant current stress (CCS). No significant increase in leakage current was observed as a function of stress time. On the other hand, stress induced capacitance changes were observed due to change in quadratic and liner coefficients of permittivity nonlinearities. Stress-induced oxygen vacancy related defect formation believed to be the cause of this shift in permittivity. (C) 2012 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
